data.body: In materials, the alignment of tiny magnetic moments within atoms gives rise to a net magnetic effect. This alignment, quantified by magnetization ($M$) and influenced by external factors through magnetic intensity ($H$), plays a crucial role in understanding the behavior of materials in magnetic fields.
